data.title: Valid Parentheses
data.body:
Given a string containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.

An input string is valid if:
1. Open brackets are closed by the same type of brackets.
2. Open brackets are closed in the correct order.
3. Every closing bracket has a corresponding open bracket of the same type.
data.editorialBody: A common solution uses a stack to track opening brackets. For every closing bracket, check if it matches the top of the stack. If the stack is empty or mismatched, return false. If the stack is empty at the end, the string is valid.
hints: Use a stack to process the parentheses.
Check matching pairs as you go.
Watch for early mismatches or leftover open brackets.
